stimulusHtml: At a large corporation, 6,000 employees from department A and 4,000 employees from department B are attending a training session. A random sample of 500 employees attending the session will be selected. Consider two sampling methods: with replacement and without replacement. How will the methods affect the standard deviations of the sampling distribution of the sample proportion of employees from department B?
choicesHtml: The standard deviations will be equal from either method.
Sampling without replacement will result in a standard deviation less than but close to 0.4(0.6)500.
Sampling without replacement will result in a standard deviation greater than but close to 0.4(0.6)500.
Sampling with replacement will result in a standard deviation less than but close to 0.4(0.6)500.
Sampling with replacement will result in a standard deviation greater than but close to 0.4(0.6)500.
